head.label.name: Appendix
head.headtext: Panel Practice Forms and Samples and Checklists

para.paratext: The Forms in this Appendix A include a variety of forms and checklists that may be useful in practice before the Judicial Panel. Many of the forms appeared in substantially similar form on the Panel's website or publications. Although some are no longer published in this manner, they continue to serve as samples that may continue to be useful. Forms and checklists that are part of the rules or that continue to be published by the Panel are identified in this Appendix as such.

row.entry: Notice of appearance and designation of counsel

Motion to vacate conditional transfer order
Resonse to motion to vacate conditional transfer order

bold.csc: Checklist and sample documents from Panel website

entry.bold: Checklist for Filing a New MDL Motion for 28 U.S.C. § 1497 Transfer
Checklist for Filing a Notice of Oppostion to Conditional Transfer Order (CTO) and Motion and Brief to Vacate the Conditional Transfer Order
United States Judicial Panel on Multidistrict Litigation Frequently Asked Questions

form.line.bold: Before the United States Judicial Panel

para.paratext: This form of caption should be used on all documents filed with the Panel. On the remaining forms in this Appendix, the presence of an appropriate caption at the beginning of the document will be indicated by [Caption]. The omission of a caption, or the use of an incomplete caption, significantly increases the burdens on the Clerk's office. If a pleading relates to only a single action before the panel, it should still include this caption, and may include an additional caption from the individual action beneath the MDL caption set forth above.

form.para.form.text: respectfully moves the Panel for an order, pursuant to 28 U.S.C. § 1407, transferring the actions identified in the Schedule of Actions served and filed herewith to the United States District Court for the District of for coordinated or consolidated pretrial proceedings.
In support of this motion, states:
The actions identified have been filed by the plaintiffs in each action in the district indicated in the Schedule of Actions, and each such action is now pending before that court.

para.paratext: The form of a motion for use in Panel proceedings is not of crucial importance. The Panel Rules require the motion to contain separately numbered paragraphs.

It is not necessary for the moving party to select a transferee district, and the motion should suffice to initiate the consideration of transfer even if that part of the motion were omitted. In practice, a party seeking transfer will almost certainly favor a particular transferee district, and it is appropriate to ask in the motion for transfer to that district.
A copy of an extensive motion for transfer used in a sex discrimination case appears in 1 Moore's Federal Practice Forms, Form 2165.1, at 300.2 to 302 (1982).

form.body.form.line: DOCUMENT FILED: MOTION OF FOR § 1407 TRANSFER OF ACTIONS TO THE DISTRICT OF

form.para.form.text: As indicated, today we have filed the above-described motion. Papers filed with the Panel and correspondence MUST bear the docket number and caption assigned by the Panel.

Enclosed is a Summary of the Rules of Procedure of the Judicial Panel on Multidistrict Litigation, 199 F.R.D. 425 (2001). Pursuant to Rule 5(c), R.P.J.P.M.L., 199 F.R.D. 428 (2001), you must notify me within the next ten days of the name and address of the attorney designated to receive service of all papers relating to practice before the Panel. ONLY ONE ATTORNEY SHALL BE DESIGNATED FOR EACH PARTY. The enclosed Notice of Appearance is for your use in complying with this Rule. We will prepare a Panel Attorney Service List on the basis of the appearances received and transmit it to you for your use in complying with our service requirements. PLEASE COOPERATE BY PROMPTLY RETURNING YOUR APPEARANCE FORM.

form.body.form.line: APPEARANCES DUE ON OR BEFORE: [Date plus 10 days]

form.para.form.text: Panel Rule 5(a) requires that responses to motions be served on ALL Parties in ALL actions and Panel Rule 7 states that the time for filing responses begins on the date of filing of the motion with the Panel. An ORIGINAL and ELEVEN copies of all pleadings are required for filing.

form.body.form.line: RESPONSES DUE ON OR BEFORE: [Date plus 15 days]

form.para.form.text: The Panel Rules also require the common party or parties in these actions to promptly notify this office of any related actions presently pending in the federal district court or filed in the future.
You will be notified when this matter has been scheduled for oral argument before the Panel. You must file a response if you wish to participate in the hearing before the Panel.

headtext.bold: Notice of appearance and designation of counsel

form.para.form.text: Court in Which Action is Pending: United States District Court for the District of .
Presiding Judge: The Honorable

para.paratext: This form is used by the plaintiff to identify all known related actions to the Panel. The information on this form should be identical to that available on the dockets of the courts involved and should be as complete as possible. The parties should be listed completely as named in the captions, including any identifying or qualifying information (e.g., “a Minnesota Corporation,” “f/k/a ” and “as trustee and not individually.”) This is not a form on which shortened forms or “et al.” is appropriate, unless so in the original complaint on file in the district court and not subsequently amended. As a convenience to the Clerk's office, it is helpful to list the parties in the same order as listed in the official docket available on PACER, as the Clerk's office uses PACER to verify this information.

This form is used both by the Panel and by the litigants. The Panel has frequently used a list containing the information mentioned above to identify the actions affected by its decisions. See, for example, Appendix A to the following decisions: In re Korean Air Lines Disaster of Sept. 1, 1983, 575 F. Supp. 342, 344–45 (J.P.M.L. 1983); In re Rely Tampon Products Liability Litigation, 533 F. Supp. 1346, 1347–50 (J.P.M.L. 1982); In re 1980 Decennial Census Adjustment Litigation, 506 F. Supp. 648, 651 (J.P.M.L. 1981); In re Corn Derivatives Antitrust Litigation, 486 F. Supp. 929, 932–33 (J.P.M.L. 1980). The Panel has used this convenient form even where only two cases are involved. See, for example, In re Garrison Diversion Unit Litigation, 458 F. Supp. 223 (J.P.M.L. 1978).

headtext.bold: Notice of service of Panel attorney service list

form.para.form.text: Pursuant to Rule 5.2(d) of the Rules of Procedure of the Judicial Panel on Multidistrict Litigation, 199 F.R.D. 425, 431 (2001), I am enclosing a copy of the Panel Attorney Service List in the above-referenced litigation. This list has been prepared on the basis of the appearances received. If you have any corrections or changes, please notify us immediately in writing and distribute copies of your notification to all counsel and/or parties appearing on the Panel Service List.

In the future, copies of opinions, order, notices, etc., distributed by this office will be sent only to attorneys appearing on this list. Rule 5.2(a) requires that a copy of this list be attached to your proof of service for the distribution of future materials directed to the Panel and is to be supplemented in the proof of service in the event of the presence of additional parties or successor counsel. If the Panel determines that Section 1407 transfer is appropriate in this litigation, a copy of this list will be directed to the designated transferee court for their reference.
[Party], in one/several/all of the actions in this docket respectfully applies to the Panel for an extension of time in which to respond to the [Motion/Order] dated , 20, and filed with the Panel.

instruction.ital: [This extension is requested for the reason that

[This extension is requested to allow counsel in this docket to contact other similarly interested parties to consider preparation and submission, for the convenience of the Panel and the parties, of a joint response to the Motion/Order.]

para.paratext: Extensions of time to file any pleading or perform any act required by the Panel Rules are authorized by Panel Rule 6.2. The rule requires the matter to be submitted in the form of any other papers submitted to the Panel, although the Clerk is authorized to act on the request for an extension. Accordingly, requests for extensions should not be made by telephone or in a letter to the clerk. The request for extension should be mailed to all parties or their attorneys.

form.para.form.text: Form of Notice of Hearing Session for actual hearing of December 3, 2015, follows on next page.

form.text.ital: The following is an actual and complete Hearing Session Order for the Panel's hearing session of December 3, 2015. This was essentially a typical hearing session, although every session is different in length and makeup of the actions involved.

form.line.instruction: [The attachment to this notice is a verbatim copy of Panel Rule 16.1. The Panel's Rules are set forth in § 4:34 of this Manual and this rule is therefore not reproduced here.]

form.head.form.headtext: PROCEDURES FOR HEARINGS OF THE JUDICIAL PANEL ON MULTIDISTRICT LITIGATION

form.body.form.line: All oral argument is governed by the provisions of Rule 16.1 of the Rules of Procedure of the Judicial Panel on Multidistrict Litigation (effective April 2, 2001). Rule 16.1 allows a maximum of twenty minutes for oral argument in each matter. In most cases, however, less time is necessary for the expression of all views and the Panel reserves the prerogative of reducing the time requested by counsel. Accordingly, counsel should be careful not to overstate the time requested for oral argument

The Panel insists that counsel limit all oral argument to the appropriate criteria. See generallyIn re Concrete Pipe, 302 F. Supp. 244, 255–56 (J.P.M.L. 1969) (concurring opinion) (discussion concerning criteria for transfer).
Rule 16.1 is duplicated in its entirety hereafter for your convenience.

form.line.instruction: [The attachment to this notice is a verbatim copy of Panel Rule 16.1. The Panel's Rules are set forth in § 4:34 of this Manual and are therefore not reproduced here.]

headtext.bold: Notice of presentation or waiver of oral argument (Panel Form 9)

form.para.form.text: THIS FORM MUST BE RETURNED
TO THE JUDICIAL PANEL
NO LATER THAN

form.line.bold: NOTICE OF PRESENTATION OR WAIVER OF ORAL ARGUMENT

form.para.form.text: This is to give notice that the following designated attorney shall PRESENT ORAL ARGUMENT at the Panel hearing session on behalf of the designated party/parties. Panel Rule 16.1 (e) states that:

Except for leave of the Panel on a showing of good cause, only those parties to actions scheduled for oral argument who have filed a motion or written response to a motion or order shall be permitted to appear before the Panel and present oral argument.
Also note Rule 16.1 (f) requiring counsel with like positions to confer prior to the oral argument for the purpose of selecting a spokesperson to avoid duplication during oral argument.
This is to give notice that the party/parties noted hereafter will WAIVE ORAL ARGUMENT pursuant to Rule 16.1(d).

This is to give notice that the party/parties noted hereafter will WAIVE ORAL ARGUMENT IF ALL OTHER PARTIES IN THIS MATTER WAIVE ORAL ARGUMENT; otherwise the following designated attorney shall present oral argument at the Panel hearing session on behalf of the designated party/parties pursuant to Rule 16.1(d).

form.body.form.line: Party/Parties Represented, District(s) & Civil Action Number(s) (list even if waiving):
Name and Address of Attorney Designated to Present Oral Argument:

ORIGINAL ONLY OF ORAL ARGUMENT APPEARANCE NEEDED FOR FILING. THIS NOTICE MUST BE SERVED ON ALL OTHER PARTIES IN THE AFFECTED LITIGATION AND A CERTIFICATE OF SERVICE WITH PANEL SERVICE LIST MUST BE ATTACHED TO THIS ORAL ARGUMENT APPEARANCE.

form.caption.form.line: IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT

form.para.form.text: The United States District Court for the District of hereby consents to the assignment of the actions involved in the above-described litigation to the Honorable for coordinated or consolidated pretrial proceedings pursuant to 28 U.S.C. § 1407.

form.body.form.line: AFTER APPROVAL, PLEASE RETURN ORIGINAL FORM TO:
THIS ASSIGNMENT IS CONFIDENTIAL UNTIL ORDER OF TRANSFER IS FILED BY THE PANEL

headtext.bold: Practice and procedure order upon transfer pursuant to 28 U.S.C. § 1407(a)

form.head.form.headtext: PRACTICE AND PROCEDURE ORDER UPON TRANSFER PURSUANT TO 28 U.S.C. § 1407(a)

form.para.form.text: This order shall govern the practice and procedure in those actions transferred to this court by the Judicial Panel on Multidistrict Litigation pursuant to their order of [date] as well as all related actions originally filed in this court or transferred or removed to this court. These actions are listed in Schedule A attached hereto. This order shall also govern the practice and procedure in any tag-along actions transferred to this Court by the Judicial Panel on Multidistrict Litigation pursuant to Rule 9 of the Rules of Procedure of that Panel subsequent to the filing of the final transfer order by the Clerk of this Court and any related actions subsequently filed in this Court or otherwise transferred or removed to this Court.
The actions described in paragraph 1 or this order are [coordinated or consolidated] for pretrial purposes.

A signed original of a pleading or paper shall he filed; no copies will be necessary. All papers filed in these actions shall bear the identification “MDL Docket No. ”, and when such paper relates to all these actions the MDL docket number shall be followed only by the notation “ALL CASES.” If such paper does not relate to all of these actions the individual docket numbers assigned by the Clerk of this Court (as listed in Schedule A hereto) of those actions to which the paper relates shall also be listed. If such paper relates to five or fewer actions the abbreviated caption of each may be listed opposite its number.
Any paper which is to be filed in any of these actions shall be filed with the Clerk of this Court and not with the transferor court.
Counsel who appeared in the transferor court prior to the transfer need not enter a separate appearance before this Court.

Prior to the first pretrial conference service of all papers shall be made on each of the attorneys on the Panel Attorney Service List attached hereto and designated as Schedule B. Any attorney who wishes to have his name added to or deleted from such Panel Attorney Service List may do so upon request to the Clerk and notice to all other persons on such service list. Service shall be deemed sufficient if made upon all attorneys on the Panel Attorney Service List.

The parties shall present to the Court at the first pretrial conference a list of attorneys for the purpose of service. Only one attorney for each party separately represented shall be included on such list.

Prior to the first pretrial conference, counsel for each group of parties whose interests are similarly aligned shall designate liaison counsel, subject to the approval of the Court. Liaison counsel shall be authorized to receive orders and notices from the Court on behalf of all parties within their liaison group. Liaison counsel shall be required to maintain complete files with copies of all documents served upon them and shall make such files available to parties within their liaison group upon request. Liaison counsel are also authorized to receive orders and notices from the Judicial Panel on Multidistrict Litigation pursuant to Rule 5(e) of the Panel's Rules of Procedure on behalf of all parties within their liaison group and shall be responsible for the preparation and transmittal of copies of such orders and notices to the parties in their liaison group.
Upon remand of any of these actions the parties will be required to provide to this Court copies of any necessary and relevant papers previously filed.

No parties to any of these actions shall be required to obtain local counsel in this district and the requirements of Rule of the Rules of this Court are waived as to any attorney appearing in these actions who is duly admitted to practice before any United States District Court.
Hearings shall not be held on any motions filed except by order of Court upon such notice as the Court may direct.

Any paper filed in any of these actions which is substantially identical to any other paper filed in another of these actions shall be sufficient if it incorporates by reference the paper to which it is substantially identical. Where counsel for more than one party plan to file substantially identical papers they shall join in the submission of such papers and file only one paper on behalf of all so joined.
Any orders including protective orders previously entered by this Court or any transferor court shall remain in full force and effect unless modified by this Court upon application.

All discovery proceedings in these actions are stayed until further order of this Court and the time requirements to perform any acts or file any papers pursuant to Rules 26 through 37, Federal Rules of Civil Procedure, are tolled until the first pretrial conference at which time a discovery schedule will be established.
The Court will be guided by the Manual for Complex Litigation approved by the Judicial Conference of the United States and counsel are directed to familiarize themselves with that publication.
All other matters will be discussed at the initial pretrial conference to be held on [date]. Within days counsel shall furnish suggestions for items to be included on the agenda for this conference.

para.paratext: The use of this order is recommended by the Panel, but is not required by it. The order was prepared by the Ad Hoc Administrative Practices Committee of the Judicial Panel on Multidistrict Litigation, and is reprinted in 75 F.R.D. 589, 602 (1978).

form.caption.form.line: BEFORE THE JUDICIAL PANEL ON MULTIDISTRICT LITIGATION

form.para.form.text: On [date], the Panel transferred [number] civil actions to the United States District Court for the [identify district court] for coordinated or consolidated pretrial proceedings pursuant to 28 U.S.C. § 1407. Since that time, more than [number] additional actions have been transferred to the [transferee court]. With the consent of that court, all such actions have been assigned to the Honorable [name of judge].
It appears from the pleadings filed in the above-captioned action that it involves questions of fact which are common to the actions previously transferred to the District of and assigned to Judge .

form.body.form.line: Pursuant to Rule 7.4 of the Rules of Procedure of the Judicial Panel on Multidistrict Litigation,199 F.R.D. 425, 435–36 (2001), the above-captioned action is hereby transferred under 28 U.S.C. § 1407 to the District of for the reasons stated in the order of [Date], and, with the consent of that court, assigned to the Honorable [Name of transferee judge].

This order does not become effective until it is filed in the office of the Clerk of the United States District Court for the [name transferor court]. The transmittal of this order to said Clerk shall be stayed fifteen (15) days from the entry thereof and if any party files a notice of opposition with the Clerk of the Panel within this fifteen (15) day period, the stay will be continued until further order of the Panel.

headtext.bold: Letter transmitting conditional transfer order (Panel Form 39)

form.para.form.text: Attached hereto is a copy of a conditional transfer order filed today by the Judicial Panel on Multidistrict Litigation involving the above-captioned action. This action is transferred pursuant to Rule 7.4 of the Rules of Procedure of the Judicial Panel on Multidistrict Litigation, 199 F.R.D. 425, 435–36 (2001). Copies of Rule 5.2, dealing with service, and Rules 7.4 and 7.5, regarding “tagalong” actions, are attached for your convenience.

Inasmuch as there is an unavoidable time lag between notification of the pendency of the tagalong action and the filing of a conditional transfer order, counsel are required by Rule 7.4(b) to notify this office BY FACSIMILE, at (202) 502-2888, of any official changes in the status of the tag-along action. These changes could involve dismissal of the action, remand to state court, transfer to another federal court, etc., as indicated by an order filed by the district court. Your cooperation would be appreciated.

form.line.bold: NOTICE OF OPPOSITION DUE ON OR BEFORE: (4 p.m. EST)

form.body.form.line: If you are considering opposing this conditional transfer order, please review Rules 7.4 and 7.5 of the Panel Rules before filing your Notice of Opposition.

form.para.form.text: Involved counsel (are/is) listed below:

form.line.bold: BEFORE THE JUDICIAL PANEL ON MULTIDISTRICT LITIGATION

form.line.ital: List only the cases you are opposing:

form.body.form.line: Jane Doe, et al. v. Smith Corporation, et al., N.D. California, C.A. No. 1:05-12345
Mary Jones, et al. V. Jones, Inc., S.D. California, C.A. No. 3:05-00001

form.line.bold: [FOR NUMEROUS CASES, ATTACH A SCHEDULE OF ACTIONS IN ASCENDING ORDER BY DISTRICT AND CIVIL ACTION NUMBER]

form.para.form.text: I represent [plaintiff/defendant] in the [above captioned actions/actions listed on the attached schedule] which are included on the conditional transfer order (CTO-). [Plaintiff/Defendant] submits this opposition to the conditional transfer order. I understand that the motion and brief to vacate are due in 14 days.

headtext.bold: Letter acknowledging receipt of notice of opposition (Panel Form 37)

form.para.form.text: (See Attached Schedule of Actions/Panel Service List)

form.caption.form.line: Motion and Brief Due on or before: [Date]

form.para.form.text: We have received and filed your Notice of Opposition to the proposed transfer of the referenced matter for coordinated or consolidated pretrial proceedings. In accordance with Rule 7.4(c) of the Rules of Procedure of the Judicial Panel on Multidistrict Litigation, 199 F.R.D. 425, 435 (2001), the conditional transfer order is stayed until further order of the Panel. You must adhere to the following filing requirements:

Pursuant to Panel Rules 5.12(a), 5.13 and 7.4(d), an original and eleven copies of your Motion and Brief to Vacate the Conditional Transfer Order, as well as a computer readable disk of the pleading in WordPerfect for Windows format, must be received in the Panel offices by the due date listed above. Fax transmission of your motion and brief will not be accepted. See Panel Rule 5.12(4). Counsel filing oppositions in more than one action are encouraged to consider filing a single motion and brief with an attached schedule of actions.

Papers must be served on the enclosed Panel Service List. Please attach a copy of this list to your certificate of service. (Counsel who have subsequently made appearances in your action should be added to your certificate of service).

form.text.bold: Rule 5.3 corporate disclosure statements are due within eleven days of the filing of the motion to vacate.

Failure to file and serve the required motion and brief within the allotted fifteen days will be considered a withdrawal of the opposition and the stay of the conditional transfer order will be lifted.

form.para.form.text: Any recent official change in the status of a referenced matter should be brought to the attention of the clerk's office as soon as possible by facsimile at (202) 502-2888. Your cooperation would be appreciated.
Transferee Judge:
Transferor Judges: See Case Captions for Involved Judges

headtext.bold: Motion to vacate conditional transfer order

form.para.form.text: [Party], pursuant to Rule 9(c) of the Rules of Procedure of the Judicial Panel on Multidistrict Litigation, hereby move(s) the Panel to vacate its order of , 20, conditionally transferring the above-captioned case(s) to the United States District Court for the [] District of . This motion is based upon the Memorandum in Support of Motion to Vacate Conditional Transfer Order and such additional materials as may properly be presented to the Panel at the time of hearing on the motion.
Pursuant to Rule 9(c), request(s) the Clerk to set this motion on for hearing at the next session of the Panel.

headtext.bold: Response to motion to vacate conditional transfer order

form.para.form.text: [Party] opposes the motion of [opponent] to vacate the Panel's Conditional Transfer Order of , 20, and respectfully requests that the above-captioned case be transferred to the District of for coordinated or consolidated pretrial proceedings, as conditionally ordered.

para.paratext: This response is necessary under the Panel Rules. Failure to respond to any motion within 15 days is deemed acquiescence in the motion. Panel Rule 7.2(c).

form.line.bold: TO COUNSEL FOR ALL PARTIES INVOLVED IN THE IN RE LITIGATION

form.para.form.text: You and each of you are hereby ordered to show cause why the actions listed on the attached Schedule should not be transferred pursuant to 28 U.S.C. § 1407 to a single district for coordinated or consolidated pretrial proceedings.

Responses to this order shall conform to the requirements of Rule 8, of the Rules of Procedure of the Judicial Panel on Multidistrict Litigation, 199 F.R.D. 425, 435–36 (2001). You are further notified that the issuing of this order by the Panel does not affect or suspend orders and discovery proceedings in the district courts in which said multidistrict litigation is pending. RPJPML (Rule 1.5).

para.paratext: This form is included for historical interest. The Panel rarely, if ever, uses orders to show cause why transfer should not occur. The conditional transfer order mechanism has worked well is now the workhorse for transfer orders for tag-along actions.

headtext.bold: Notice of filing order to show cause

form.line.bold: NOTICE OF FILING OF ORDER TO SHOW CAUSE
TO COUNSEL FOR ALL PARTIES INVOLVED IN

form.para.form.text: Re: Docket No. -In re Litigation

The enclosed order to show cause was filed today by the Judicial Panel on Multidistrict Litigation involving the actions listed on the attached Schedule. All papers filed with the Panel and correspondence relating to this matter MUST bear the above docket number and caption.

The Rules of Procedure of the Judicial Panel on Multidistrict Litigation, 199 F.R.D. 425, 435–36 (2001), Rule 5.2(c), requires that you notify me within eleven days of filing of this order of the name and address of the attorney designated to receive service of all pleadings, orders, notices and other papers relating to practice before the Panel. Enclosed is a Notice of Appearance for your use in complying with the requirements of Rule 5.2(c). This form must be returned to me no later than , 20. ONLY ONE ATTORNEY SHALL BE DESIGNATED FOR EACH PARTY.

Your response to the show cause order must be served on all parties in all actions in accordance with Rule 5.2(c), RPJPML. We will prepare a Panel Attorney Service List on the basis of the appearances and transmit it to you for your convenience in complying with the service requirements of Rule 7.3. Please cooperate by promptly returning your appearance form.
With reference to Rule 7.3, the time for filing responses began on , 20. AN ORIGINAL AND TEN COPIES ARE REQUIRED BY THE PANEL RULES.

You will be notified when this matter has been scheduled for oral argument before the Panel. As I am sure you are aware, however, a written response to this show cause order is required if you wish to participate in any hearing before the Panel.

headtext.bold: Motion for transfer of tag-along action

form.para.form.text: This motion is identical in form to the Motion for Transfer set forth above.

para.paratext: The motion for transfer of a tag-along action is not fundamentally different from any other transfer motion. The motion should recite, in one of the numbered paragraphs, the fact of transfer and that the transferred actions are pending in the transferee court. The grounds for the motion should include any overlap of parties or any other grounds favoring transfer.

form.para.form.text: Pursuant to Rule 7.6(c)(ii) of the Rules of Procedure of the Judicial Panel on Multidistrict Litigation, the undersigned transferee judge suggests that the above-entitled action[s] be remanded to the District of , the district in which it was commenced.

The above-entitled action was transferred by the Panel, by order filed , 20, for coordinated or consolidated pretrial proceedings before the undersigned. This case has, since its transfer by the Panel, been handled by the undersigned in conjunction with certain cases pending in this district at the time transfer was ordered.

instruction.ital: [Pretrial proceedings in this case have been completed, and this case is ready for trial in the transferor district.]

[Pretrial proceedings in the common issues in this case and the other cases pending in this district have been completed. The discovery on the issues unique to this case can best be completed in the transferor district.]

[All remaining cases in this multidistrict litigation have been settled and dismissed, and it appears that remand is appropriate in order to permit this litigation to be brought to a conclusion in the most expeditious manner.]

form.para.form.text: For these reasons, the just and efficient handling of this matter will best be served by the remand of this action to the District of , the district in which it was commenced.
and

respectfully moves the Panel for an order, pursuant to 28 U.S.C. § 1407(a), remanding this action for the convenience of parties and witnesses and to promote the just and efficient conduct of this action.
This motion and proceedings is based upon all of the files, records, in this action, upon the Affidavit of served and filed herewith, and as set forth below:

para.paratext: A motion for remand by a party must be accompanied by an affidavit establishing that pretrial activities are complete in the transferee court. Panel Rule 7.6(d). A copy of any final pretrial order should be attached to that affidavit.
A response to this motion should follow the form of a response to a motion to transfer before the Panel. The procedures are essentially parallel in all respects.

form.para.form.text: Pursuant to the Rules of Procedure of the Judicial Panel on Multidistrict Litigation 199 F.R.D. 425, 435–36 (2001), Rule 7.5(c)(ii), Judge has advised the Panel that remand of the above-captioned action to the transferor court for further proceedings is appropriate.
You and each of you are hereby ordered to show cause why the above-captioned actions should not be remanded to the District of pursuant to 28 U.S.C. § 1407.
Responses to this order shall conform with the requirements of Rules of Procedure of the Judicial Panel on Multidistrict Litigation, 199 F.R.D. 425, 435–36 (2001), Rule 7.4(e).

The transferee court in this litigation has advised the Panel that coordinated or consolidated pretrial proceedings in the above-captioned action assigned to it have been completed and that remand of the action to the transferor court, as provided in 28 U.S.C. § 1407(a), is appropriate.
IT IS THEREFORE ORDERED that the above-captioned action be remanded to the United States District Court for the District of .

IT IS ALSO ORDERED that pursuant to Rule 7.6 of the Rules of Procedure of the Judicial Panel on Multidistrict Litigation, 199 F.R.D. 425, 436–38 (2001), the transmittal of this order to the transferee clerk for filing shall be stayed fifteen days from the date of this order and if any party files a Notice of Opposition with the Clerk of the Panel within this fifteen-day period, the stay will be continued until further order of the Panel. This order does not become effective until it is filed in the office of the Clerk for the United States District Court for the District of .

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that, pursuant to Rule 7.6(g), R.P.J.P.M.L., and coinciding with the effective date of this order, the parties shall furnish the Clerk for the District of with a stipulation or designation of the contents of the record to be remanded and furnish said Clerk all necessary copies of any pleadings or other matter filed so as to enable said Clerk to comply with the order of remand.

headtext.bold: United States Judicial Panel on Multidistrict Litigation Fee Schedule

para.paratext: Following are fees to be charged for services to be performed by the Clerk of the United States Judicial Panel on Multidistrict Litigation. No fees are to be charged for services rendered on behalf of the United States, with the exception of those specifically prescribed in items 1 and 3. No fees under this schedule shall be charged to federal agencies or programs which are funded from judiciary appropriations, including, but not limited to, agencies, organizations, and individuals providing services authorized by the Criminal Justice Act, 18 U.S.C. § 3006A.

For every search of the records of the court conducted by the clerk of the court or a deputy clerk, $31 per name or item searched. This fee shall apply to services rendered on behalf of the United States if the information requested is available through electronic access.
For certification of any document or paper, whether the certification is made directly on the document or by separate instrument, $11.

For reproducing any record or paper, $.50 per page. This fee shall apply to paper copies made from either: (1) original documents; or (2) microfiche or microfilm reproductions of the original records. This fee shall apply to services rendered on behalf of the United States if the record or paper requested is available through electronic access.

For retrieval of one box of a records from a Federal Records Center, National Archives, or other storage location removed from the place of business of the court, $64. For retrievals involving multiple boxes, $39 for each additional box. For electronic retrievals, $10 plus any charges assessed by the Federal Records Center, National Archives, or other storage location removed from the place of business of the courts.
For any payment returned or denied for insufficient funds, $53.
Maslon Edelman Borman & Brand, LLP, Minneapolis, Minnesota.
